questions.question: What is the chemical formula for the coordination polymer that demonstrates exceptional water sorption, stability, and cyclability?
How does the unit cell volume change upon water adsorption in {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n?
questions.answer: The unit cell volume increases by 34% upon water adsorption.

questions.question: What method was used to confirm the phase purity of different hydration states of the coordination polymer?
questions.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) was used to confirm the phase purity.

questions.question: What is the role of manganese(II) in the stability and 'breathing' performance of the CN-bridged framework upon water adsorption/desorption?
questions.answer: Manganese(II) not only provides paramagnetic properties of the material but is also responsible for the structural integrity of the framework.

questions.question: True or False: The coordination polymer {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n shows permanent porosity as evidenced by nitrogen adsorption isotherms.
What technique was employed to monitor the state of MnII sites during real-time dehydration/rehydration experiments?
questions.answer: Electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectroscopy was employed.

questions.question: What unique property does {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n demonstrate upon irradiation with 450 nm light at low temperatures?
True or False: The compound {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n can undergo tens of water vapor pressure- or temperature-swing cycles without losing its water sorption capacity.
How does the water-induced breathing behavior of {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n compare to that of flexible MOFs?
questions.answer: The breathing behavior of {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n, with a 34% volume increase, falls within the range observed for flexible MOFs.

questions.question: True or False: The dehydration-driven transformations in {[Mn(imH)]2[Mo(CN)8]}n are irreversible.
